Detailed Description

Class for holding a licence key sent to user.

When packed into or from a packet UserLicenceKey looks like this. The first TYPE_LICENCE_KEY and Total size in bytes and the last TYPE_LICENCE_KEY is read by someone else when read from a packet. {tabular}{lll} Pos & Size & Destription \ pos & 4 bytes & TYPE_LICENCE_KEY \ +4 & 2 bytes & Total size in bytes \ +6 & 4 bytes & TYPE_LICENCE_KEY \ +10 & 2 bytes & Total size in bytes \ +12 & 4 bytes & Licence ID \ +16 & 2 bytes & Licence length \ +18 & 2 bytes & Product length \ +20 & 2 bytes & Key type length \ +22 & Licence length bytes & Licence data\ X & String & Product string \ X & String & Key type \ {tabular}

Definition at line 45 of file UserLicenceKey.h.

bool UserLicenceKey::extract15Digits (  MC2String &  target  )  const
 

Extract the first 14 digits from the licence key and adds the 15th Luhn check digit to target.

Used to get the significant digits for an imei.

Parameters:
target The digits are added to this string.
Returns:
True if 14 digits was found and only '-'s was skipped, the 15th check digits is added to target too.

bool UserLicenceKey::isIMEISV (   )  const
 

Checks if the licence key is of a format such that we think it contains both IMEI & SV, in which case we have some special handling which removes the SV part before storing the key in the database.
